**Stoneskin** is a level 2 [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")/[Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") spell which temporarily makes the caster's skin hard as stone.

## Useful Info

Stoneskin grants a temporary bonus to [AC](/AC "AC"):

> **AC Bonus:** 2 + (power/20)  
> **Max:** +7

Each casting increases Stoneskin's duration by `8 + 2d(power)` turns, up to a maximum of 50.

This AC bonus stacks with [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form"), but it can't be combined with [Ozocubu's Armour](/Ozocubu%27s_Armour "Ozocubu's Armour"). It does not work with most [form](/Form "Form") spells; only [Beastly Appendage](/Beastly_Appendage "Beastly Appendage"), [Blade Hands](/Blade_Hands "Blade Hands"), and Statue Form work with Stoneskin. The [undead](/Undead "Undead") ([Ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [Mummies](/Mummies "Mummies"), [Vampires](/Vampires "Vampires") below [Full](/Food "Food")) can't use this spell.

## Strategy

A weaker version of [Ozocubu's Armour](/Ozocubu%27s_Armour "Ozocubu's Armour"), without encumbrance restrictions, that doesn't melt against [fire](/Fire "Fire"). If you can cast Stoneskin (but not Ozocubu's), it's generally worth using - either during exploration or at the start of most fights.

Note that Stoneskin will not notify you when its duration is almost over. Should you be in the middle of a pitched battle, consider casting it again when you have a spare turn to guarantee you maintain your AC bonus until the end of the fight.

## History

- Stoneskin was removed in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), the effects of this spell were boosted while in Statue Form, using the formula 3 + ((11 \* spell power)/100) (Max +14).
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), this spell's AC bonus was dependent on your Earth Magic skill, not your spell power, using the following formula:

> **AC Bonus:** 2 + (Earth Magic/5)  
> **Max:** +7 at 25 Earth Magic  
> **w/ Statue Form: **3 + ((9 \* Earth Magic)/20)  
> **Max:** +12 at 27 Earth Magic

Useful Info

Stoneskin grants a temporary bonus to AC:

AC Bonus: 2 + (power/20)
Max: +7

Each casting increases Stoneskin's duration by 8 + 2d(power) turns, up to a maximum of 50.

This AC bonus stacks with Statue Form, but it can't be combined with Ozocubu's Armour. It does not work with most form spells; only Beastly Appendage, Blade Hands, and Statue Form work with Stoneskin. The undead (Ghouls, Mummies, Vampires below Full) can't use this spell.

A weaker version of Ozocubu's Armour, without encumbrance restrictions, that doesn't melt against fire. If you can cast Stoneskin (but not Ozocubu's), it's generally worth using - either during exploration or at the start of most fights.

Note that Stoneskin will not notify you when its duration is almost over. Should you be in the middle of a pitched battle, consider casting it again when you have a spare turn to guarantee you maintain your AC bonus until the end of the fight.

History

  • Prior to 0.17, the effects of this spell were boosted while in Statue Form, using the formula 3 + ((11 * spell power)/100) (Max +14).
  • Prior to 0.15, this spell's AC bonus was dependent on your Earth Magic skill, not your spell power, using the following formula:
AC Bonus: 2 + (Earth Magic/5)
Max: +7 at 25 Earth Magic
